question: Heliodorusâ€™ a Greek ambassador of the Indo-Greek king was sent to the court of which ruler?
explanation: Heliodorus was the Greek ambassador sent to the court of Sunga King, Bhagbhadra by the Greek King of Taxila, Antialkidas. Heliodorus erected famous votive Heliodorus pillar around 110 BC near Vidisha, Madhya Pradesh.
